C

CSM_READER_NAME_REGEX - Static variable in interface org.eclipse.keyple.example.pc.calypso.PcscReadersSettings
 

D

Demo_HoplinkTransaction - Class in org.eclipse.keyple.example.pc.calypso
This Calypso demonstration code consists in: Setting up a two-reader configuration (main) and adding an observer method (update) Starting a card operation when a PO presence is notified (operatePoTransactions) Opening a logical channel with the CSM (C1 CSM is expected) see (CSM_C1_ATR_REGEX) Attempting to open a logical channel with the PO with 3 options: Selection with a fake AID Selection with a Navigo AID Selection with a Hoplink AID Display SeRequest/SeResponse data (printSelectAppResponseStatus) If the Hoplink selection succeeded, do 3 Hoplink transactions (operateMultipleHoplinkTransactions).
Demo_HoplinkTransaction() - Constructor for class org.eclipse.keyple.example.pc.calypso.Demo_HoplinkTransaction

Demo_SeProtocolDetection - Class in org.eclipse.keyple.example.pc.generic
This class handles the reader events generated by the SeProxyService

doHoplinkThreeStepReadWriteTransaction(PoSecureSession, ApduResponse, boolean) - Method in class org.eclipse.keyple.example.pc.calypso.Demo_HoplinkTransaction

doHoplinkTwoStepAuthentication(PoSecureSession, ApduResponse, boolean) - Method in class org.eclipse.keyple.example.pc.calypso.Demo_HoplinkTransaction
Do an 2-step Hoplink transaction: Process identification Process Opening and Closing

operateMultipleHoplinkTransactions(PoSecureSession, ApduResponse) - Method in class org.eclipse.keyple.example.pc.calypso.Demo_HoplinkTransaction
Chain 3 Hoplink transactions: 2-step, 3-step, 2-step (see @link doHoplinkTwoStepAuthentication and @link doHoplinkThreeStepReadWriteTransaction)
